main event: Two civilians observed an unidentified shiny object moving rapidly from horizon to horizon in Fresno, California on August 29, 1952.
interesting points: The observers first noted a loud, metallic sound before seeing the bright light., The object was described as being in a fixed position in the sky for about 15 seconds., The light was lost to view after rising vertically at a rapid speed., The observation was made from the backyard of a private residence., The observer was a 32-year-old public school teacher and amateur astronomer.
witness description: two civilians, one being a 32-year-old public school teacher
